channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sylvester Turner, Congressman and Former Houston Mayor, Dies at 70
item.description: A former mayor of Houston, he was in attendance at the president’s speech on Tuesday night but was later taken to a hospital.

item.title: Goldman, JPMorgan among banks offering more Russia-linked trades
item.description: Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase are among banks that have been acting as brokers to facilitate growing investor demand for ways to trade Russian-rela...

item.title: ‘We Have Given Him Everything’: Trump’s Tariffs Stun Mexico
item.description: President Claudia Sheinbaum’s government made major concessions — and delivered results — to avert President Trump’s 25 percent tariffs. He imposed th...

item.title: Elon Musk’s DOGE slapped government-issued credit cards with a $1 spending limit. Workers say they can’t do their jobs.
item.description: The cost-cutting spree has hampered workers’ ability to buy office or lab supplies, access legal filings, or travel for work.

item.title: C.I.A. Director Says U.S. Has Paused Intelligence Sharing With Ukraine
item.description: Trump administration officials say the halt in assistance is a warning to the Ukrainians of the consequences of not cooperating with the president.

item.title: Want a more hopeful America? Increase awareness of past progress
item.description: At least two-thirds of Americans believe the nation will become economically weaker, less important, and more divided by 2050.

item.title: The Wizard of Vinyl Is in Kansas
item.description: Chad Kassem is on a mission — saving listeners “from bad sound” — at the rural factory where he pores over LPs from some of music’s most important art...

item.title: Goldman wins rare solo role on blockbuster $19 billion port deal
item.description: One of the biggest infrastructure deals in recent years has a clear winner on Wall Street: Goldman Sachs.

item.title: French Child Sex Abuse Trial of Ex-Doctor Highlights Unheeded Warnings
item.description: Joël Le Scouarnec is charged with raping or sexually assaulting 299 people, mostly his young patients. His family’s testimony suggested a culture of s...

item.title: EU leaders scramble to devise a Ukraine defense plan after Trump revokes U.S. support: ‘Europe faces a clear and present danger on a scale none of us have seen in our adult lifetime’
item.description: Trump paused U.S. military supplies to Ukraine after pressing Volodymyr Zelenskyy to engage in negotiations with Russia to end the war.

item.title: U.S. and Hamas Hold Direct Talks Over Hostages in Gaza, Officials Say
item.description: The talks marked a significant departure from previous negotiations involving the United States and Hamas, which the U.S. government has for decades d...

item.title: Supreme Court Rejects Trump’s Bid to Freeze Foreign Aid
item.description: The move came after Chief Justice Roberts temporarily paused a trial judge’s order requiring the administration to release more than $1.5 billion.

item.title: Justice Dept. Indicts 12 Chinese in Hacking Plot Against U.S. Targets
item.description: The suspects were charged as part of what U.S. officials called a “hackers for hire” system whose primary customer was the Chinese government.

item.title: A Viral Video of a Chained Woman in China and the Secret Campaign to Save Her
item.description: The accidental discovery of the woman led to a video that went viral, spurring public outrage. The Communist Party quashed the discussion, but the ang...

item.description: The talks marked a significant departure from previous negotiations involving the United States and Hamas, which the U.S. government has for decades d...
